SOfun 1.75
  • Reference

    SOfun

    Functions I’ve written as answers to R questions on Stack Overflow. Destined to be the most important R package you have ever loaded in your R session.

    Installation

    source("http://news.mrdwab.com/install_github.R")
install_github("mrdwab/SOfun")

    Contents

    The “SOfun” package is filled with a very strongly cohesive set of functions, as indicated below:

    1. adjCombos: Adjacent combinations.
    2. almostComplete: Like complete.cases, but more flexible.
    3. appendMe: Like rbind() but adds the source in the process. Just use rbindlist from “data.table” with the idcol argument instead. Much better….
    4. arrayExtractor: Extracts data from an array.
    5. CharNumSplit: Splits strings like “ABC123” into “ABC” and “123” or strings like “123ABC” into “123” and “ABC”.
    6. clc:Clear your workspace.
    7. col_flatten and col_flattenLong: Likely replacements for listCol_l and listCol_w from “splitstackshape”.
    8. completeVecs: Like complete.cases() but for vectors.
    9. concat.split.DT: Work in progress on an fread() approach to concat.split() from “splitstackshape”. Now part of “splitstackshape” (since V1.4.0 and above).
    10. dailyCalendar and WeekDays: Creates a daily calendar in R.
    11. Diag: A faster version of diag().
    12. dist2df: Converts “dist” objects to data.frames.
    13. dupe_thresh: Filters a vector according to the number of duplicates in the vector.
    14. expandRows: Expand the rows of a data.frame by a column in the data.frame or by a specified vector. Now a part of “splitstackshape”.
    15. Factor: Enhanced version of factor() that allows duplicated levels to be used more directly.
    16. findFirst: Finds the position of the nth non-sequential specified value in a vector.
    17. ftable2df ftable2dt: Converts the output of ftable() to a data.table. NOTE: Changed from data.frame to data.table.
    18. fwf2csv: Uses awk to convert a fixed-width file to a CSV based on stacks of whitespace.
    19. getMyRows: Extracts a range of rows from a data.frame.
    20. GroupedMedian: Calculates the median of grouped data.
    21. grouped_stem: Creates a grouped stem-and-leaf plot.
    22. helpExtract: Extracts portions of R help files for use in Sweave or R-markdown documents.
    23. lengthener: Lengthens a dataset by the combination of its columns.
    24. letterRep: Wraps the letters constant making unique values.
    25. list_unlister: Unlists columns of lists by row creating combinations of values in the process.
    26. makemeNA: Converts specific values in a data.frame into NA.
    27. mc_tribble: A dput-like output for a “tribble” for those living in the tidyverse.
    28. melt_wide: Reshapes double- and tripple-wide data.tables into longer data.frames.
    29. moveMe: Shuffles the order of a vector around using natural language statements.
    30. mySOreputation: Parse your reputation page from any of the Stack Exchange sites.
    31. naLast: Moves NA values in columns or rows to the end of their columns or rows.
    32. needleInHaystack: Finds a needle in a haystack.
    33. ragged: Displays a data.frame with ragged keys/grouping variables.
    34. read.mtable: Reads files that have multiple tables in one go.
    35. replace_portion: Searches for a pattern in a vector and replaces it with another pattern.
    36. ReshapeLong: Reshapes data with multiple measurements in a wide format into a long format with one column per measurement type.
    37. Riffle: Like the riffle function from Mathematica, sort of.
    38. SampleToSum: Samples from a specified range for a vector of a specified length adding up to a specified value.
    39. shifter: “Shifts” values in a vector.
    40. shuffler: Shuffles the elements of a vector such that no single element is in the same place it was before.
    41. sortEnds: Selects the top-n highest or lowest values in a vector.
    42. TabulateInt: Modifies tabulate to work with non-positive integers too.
    43. this_by_n: Applies a function by every n values to a vector minus the first value.
    44. tidyHTML: Downloads and parses a page after the page has been sent to the online HTML Tidy web service.
    45. toColClasses: Converts data.frame columns to specified column classes.
    46. TriIndex: Given the number of rows in a symmetric matrix, calculate the row and column indices of the upper or lower triangles.
    47. TrueSeq: Convert the TRUE values in a vector into a sequence by groups of values.
    48. unlist_by_row and unlist_by_col: Unlists a rectangular dataset by row or column.
    49. vec2symmat: Converts a vector to a symmetric matrix (if possible).
    50. vectorBind: Binds named vectors into a matrix.
    51. word_value: Uses the numeric position of the letters in a word to create a numeric value for a word.
    52. write.Hmisc.SPSS: Writes SPSS files with label information (when using the Hmisc package).

    Don’t ask me why I did this.
